1500199937115668483.text: While touring orphan well sites in Cuyahoga Valley National Park this morning, young Ohioans stopped @SecDebHaaland and me. It was a pleasure to speak with two future leaders. https://t.co/z8gEV7EMlm

1500148235540873219.text: Spending my morning with Secretary of Interior @SecDebHaaland at Cuyahoga Valley National Park, touring the orphan well sites—a Great American Outdoors Act #GAOA maintenance funding project. The Act’s $2.6 billion investment nationwide will preserve our public lands. https://t.co/cmHnZmLOuC

1499895103070081028.text: Through a partnership with Tri-C, GS is paying and connecting interns with local small businesses. Interns gain valuable marketable skills and business owners grow their future workforce.   #GS10KSmallBiz https://t.co/uoKH7eEhgz

1499895095725854721.text: I rounded out my day at my alma mater, Tri-C, with  Goldman Sachs Foundation President, Asahi Pompey, discussing  10K Small Businesses Fellows pilot program and its local workforce development impact.

1499867333548027907.text: What a productive and exciting day! I am now with the Secretary of the Interior, Deb Haaland, OH Senator Sherrod Brown, and labor leaders discussing ongoing investments from President Biden’s Infrastructure Law. https://t.co/3lyltO1MQe

1499772570765299712.text: I am currently hosting USDA Undersecretary Xochitl Torress Small and RD OH State Director Jonathan McCracken in Cleveland! We’re discussing, with other local leaders, our continued partnership to help Ohioans achieve more equitable access to healthy foods.#USDARD https://t.co/8XWAyj8qjb

1499547213055373323.text: #WomensHistoryMonth: On this day 109 years ago, thousands of women marched in Washington, D.C. – the first mass protest for a woman’s right to vote. We must protect that right for ALL Americans.  That’s why I support the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act.

1499425312496619529.text: It’s official! We kept our promise to take care of our veterans when they come home.  I joined my colleagues to pass the Honoring our #PACTAct  today, so potentially 3.5 million veterans exposed to burn pits and other toxins can access the care they deserve.

1499105568035905539.text: #SOTU showed America the strength, experience and compassion of our President and why strong American leadership is critical at home and abroad. #POTUS.

1499088846415351813.text: Howard University is 155 years old today! #HU155!  Support our HBCUs who have given the world many of its greatest leaders and innovators. That’s why I support no more underfunding of HBCUs through the IGNITE HBCU Excellence Act!  #IGNITE!

1498858888455770121.text:
We are the only nation that can be defined by one word: Possibilities.

👏👏👏

1498851291317129219.text:
Lower prescription drug prices.

Cut childcare costs.

Extend the child tax credit.

That’s how we lower costs for American families. #SOTU

1498848369753694208.text:
People have talked about infrastructure for generations.

Last year we actually got it done.

No more infrastructure weeks—now it’s infrastructure decade.

1498811630343397379.text:
I stand on the shoulders of the trailblazing women who came before me.

I am proud to work alongside the record number of women in Congress today to secure fair pay, improve our childcare, and fight for women's equality.

#WomensHistoryMonth https://t.co/7qMw1CKmCM

1498798554181165058.text:
We are building a better America—and we are building it from the bottom up and the middle out. 

Thanks, President Biden. #SOTU

1498767119344975872.text: Proud to join my House colleagues in standing in bipartisan support for Ukraine. 🇺🇦 https://t.co/hw5T8z5iWf

1498761142977585161.text:
The Emergency Food Assistance Program is critical to fighting hunger.

It moves food from farms to our food banks and on to the hungry families they serve.

Proud to lead a bipartisan letter with @RepJimmyPanetta & @repdonyoung calling for more funding for this program. https://t.co/9zPI77fe7Q

1498456189792927747.text:
Despite more than 200 attempts since 1900, lynching has NEVER been designated a federal crime. 

The House just moved us one step closer to addressing this shameful injustice by passing the Emmett Till #AntilynchingAct.

1498436423451566086.text:
Good Afternoon, @SecFudge!

Great seeing my friend and mentor at the White House today. https://t.co/nse65artmL

1498431155842039810.text: Honored to be at the @WhiteHouse today as @POTUS closed out #BlackHistoryMonth by recognizing the many contributions that African Americans have made to our great nation. https://t.co/k64v24ylx2

1497249579879878659.text:
Closing out Black History Month by writing the next chapter. 

What an important day for our nation.

1497235377643560978.text:
I applaud @POTUS' historic nomination of Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson.

Judge Jackson's distinguished career, unparalleled integrity, and lifelong commitment to justice make her extremely well-qualified to serve on the Supreme Court. 

Time to make history. #SheWillRise

1496920259642679300.text: This #PublicSchoolsWeek, I would like to thank the teachers, administrators, and school service workers who make a difference in the lives of our students each and every day.

1496854461897228293.text:
I am praying for the Ukrainian people during this unjustified invasion. America and its allies will hold Russia accountable for the destruction and devastating loss of life it will bring. 

America stands with Ukraine and with democracy.

1496597643241345030.text:
Elijah Cummings often said, “Our children are the living messages we send to a future we will never see.”

We must ensure every student in America has access to a quality public education that prepares them for a lifetime of success. 

#PublicSchoolsWeek

1496558119576608780.text:
Founded in 1915, the Karamu House in Cleveland is the oldest African American theater in the country.

While living in Cleveland, Langston Hughes attended classes at Karamu, and he returned throughout his life to have his works premiered at the theater.

#BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/HxAqwNCSMV

1496542370665537542.text:
More than 1 in 3 Black mothers say that cost is the biggest barrier to child care.  

By investing in child care and Pre-K, we can help more families access quality, affordable care. https://t.co/uPCBnnCayv

1496534829084590081.text:
"Infrastructure" can seem abstract, but @neorsd is right: investing in infrastructure does save lives. 

You can count on me for a retweet! https://t.co/MhmiQ8VH5K

1496242313940639752.text:
Today, I hosted mayors from across #OH11 for a roundtable meeting. 

We discussed the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, as well as other key policy priorities for Northeast Ohio. https://t.co/BnV2YsO6eh

1496213353584377862.text:
Ahmaud Arbery should still be with us. 

Today's verdict will not bring him back, but it is another  important step towards accountability and justice.  

My prayers remain with Mr. Arbery's family and the lives he touched.

1496181773331480584.text:
Russia's escalating aggression in Eastern Ukraine is an unacceptable violation of Ukraine's sovereignty and the rule of law. 

I commend the Biden Administration for its swift response and continued efforts to work with our allies to hold Vladimir Putin accountable.

1496157761549357066.text:
More than 3 million children fell back into poverty after the Child Tax Credit expired in December. 

Let's be clear: child poverty is preventable. 

Congress must extend the Child Tax Credit.

1495827453884997634.text:
This #PresidentsDay, I am grateful for @POTUS' leadership over the last year.
 
We’re creating jobs, rebuilding our outdated infrastructure, restoring our leadership abroad, and so much more.

1494767721912967175.text:
The last time the federal minimum wage was increased in 2009, Boom Boom Pow was topping the Billboard charts.

It’s well past time to raise the wage to $15/hour.

1494730062448316418.text:
What an honor it was to join President Biden in Ohio yesterday as he announced the Infrastructure Law's $1 billion investment in cleaning up our Great Lakes. 

In Cleveland, this will mean addressing historic contamination of the Cuyahoga River and improving its water quality. https://t.co/gfL36cZNXd

1494712463518015501.text:
All-Star Weekend is officially here in our All-Star city. 

Let's have a great—and safe—weekend, Cleveland. 

#ALLSTARWEEKEND

1494687706445713408.text:
I usually take my coffee with cream and 2 sugars, but today I'll take it #UnionStrong. 

Standing in solidarity with the Starbucks workers organizing across Cleveland.
https://t.co/51cyVwyXGV

1494465092079042563.text:
Thanks to the thousands of OH-11 constituents who joined me tonight for my third townhall.

We discussed everything from the Infrastructure Law’s impact on Ohio to the future of the Child Tax Credit. https://t.co/vdBv0x8dhJ

1494395102969667587.text:
At 6PM this evening, I will be hosting my third telephone townhall. 

You can register ahead at https://t.co/ezUeQKPWZ3 or call in at 6 PM at 833-946-1545. https://t.co/ykSsr6KNAQ

1494381741519351809.text: Thank you @POTUS for coming to Ohio to talk about how the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law is investing in our workers, our communities, and our future. https://t.co/gFZlwFgbK3

1494326976219213827.text:
Looking forward to welcoming @POTUS to Ohio today as he announces $1 billion in infrastructure funding to clean up our Great Lakes.

Less pollution. Safer drinking water. Better roads. More jobs.

The Infrastructure Law is delivering for Ohio.
https://t.co/L4EGoQxe67

1494315992171925506.text:
The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law included the single largest federal investment ever in restoring our Great Lakes.

This $1 billion investment will help clean up pollution across the region, including the Cuyahoga River right here in Northeast Ohio.

1494053286420357121.text:
Want an update on my work in Congress so far? Or do you have a question you'd like to ask me?

Join me for my third telephone town hall tomorrow at 6 PM. Register now at https://t.co/ezUeQKPWZ3. https://t.co/Fsjk3sb0ac

1494025322949394448.text:
Dr. Lisa Cook's distinguished career as an economist and years of public service make her extremely qualified to serve on the @federalreserve Board.

I join my @TheBlackCaucus colleagues in calling for her swift Senate confirmation.

1493598798005821447.text:
This Thursday, I will be hosting my third telephone townhall to update you on my work in Congress and answer your questions. 

Register to attend at https://t.co/ezUeQKPWZ3. https://t.co/bmoDIbD6Uv

1493320156055023617.text:
Big news: More than 10 million people have enrolled in the new Affordable Connectivity Program, which provides internet discounts to low-income Americans. 

This is the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law in action.

More information: https://t.co/VYZ0j58iMl

1493273639134846978.text:
Four years ago, 17 lives were cut tragically short at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School. 

My heart is with the Parkland community today, and I stand with the families and survivors continuing to push for common sense gun laws.

1492577470465331201.text:
Oh—and I got my new official headshot!
https://t.co/cjFrVrNX9g

1492576364943265795.text:
It's also why I am announcing a new event called "Coffee with the Congresswoman." 

Each month, I will meet with a small group of constituents to hear about their top priorities. 

If you are interested in attending, please sign up at https://t.co/QINGRb0KSE.

1492576363613675525.text:
The people of #OH11 have been instrumental to this work across my first 100 days.

I am here to make their voice heard in Washington.

That's why I've held 2 townhalls and plan to hold my next townhall next week. 
https://t.co/YCJOuYxdgU

1492576362187694081.text:
In my first 100 days, I've taken to the floor to discuss the Infrastructure Law, call for Senate action on voting rights legislation, and speak on the need to extend the Child Tax Credit. 

https://t.co/dBhMeICujZ

1492576361218727936.text:
In December, I received my committee assignments to @HouseAgDems & @OversightDems. 

Since then, I've participated in numerous hearings on everything from @USDA's emergency feeding programs to our government's response to the threats of climate change and cyber attacks.

1492576360178585602.text:
I've cosponsored 60 bills, including legislation to:

➡️ Raise the minimum wage to $15
➡️ Ban assault weapons
➡️ Allow Medicare to negotiate drug prices
➡️ Protect the right of public servants to organize
➡️ Make historic investments in HBCUs
➡️ Improve access to birth control

1492576358861578242.text:
Since November 4, I have introduced five new bills. 

For my first bill, I partnered with colleagues from across the aisle to find new pathways to enroll more of our veterans in preventive health programs. 
https://t.co/usyZqzXeCT

1492570060933812226.text:
Just this week, I voted for the Postal Service Reform Act. 

With worsening mail delays in Northeast Ohio and across the country, this bill would improve @USPS operations and ensure Americans receive their mail on time. 

https://t.co/tMrup6Xc7G

1492570059679617029.text:
I've also helped pass several bills that await further action in the Senate. 

This includes the John R. Lewis: Freedom to Vote Act, long overdue legislation to protect the right to vote. 

https://t.co/we3YLEbM1k

1492570058538823680.text:
I've cast nearly 150 votes across my first 100 days.

This includes bills @POTUS signed into law, such as legislation to prevent cuts to Medicare, hire more veterans as health workers, and expand in-state tuition to family members of service men and women who died in active duty.

1492568183659761670.text:
The Law will also help replace the more than 650,000 lead pipes and service lines across Ohio, guaranteeing access to safe drinking water.  

And it will expand access to high-speed internet to the thousands of Northeast Ohio households without it.

1492568182565048336.text:
The Infrastructure Law is already delivering funding to Ohio is to repair roads, more than half of which in Cleveland have pavement in poor condition. 

Millions will go to RTA and Akron Metro to replace outdated vehicles, build new garages and expand services in our region.

1492568180891529216.text:
Two weeks later, I was at the White House as @POTUS signed this historic bill into law. 

https://t.co/pR1L7IqqjH

1492568179826167810.text:
Less than 48 hours after being sworn in, I supported House passage of the Bipartisan Infrastructure Bill.

I voted to bring jobs to Northeast Ohio, fix our crumbling roads, improve public transportation, deliver clean water to families, and expand access to high-speed internet.

1492568178811154437.text:
When I was sworn in last November, I promised to always put the people first. 

Here's how I've been working to deliver results for the people across my first 100 days in office. 

🧵

1492526843324469249.text:
Today marks 100 days since I took office. 

I am proud of what we have been able to accomplish together. 

I look forward to building on this progress over the next 100 days—and beyond. https://t.co/PIYO3yqujd

1491878583773675526.text:
Thanks to the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, Ohio will receive $20 million this year to invest in EV charging infrastructure.

This funding will help to accelerate EV adoption, reduce emissions and improve air quality, all while creating good-paying jobs. https://t.co/bCAV4u4Pmh

1491870435260223492.text:
I promised to always put the people of #OH11 first, and that means I want to hear from you! 

Please consider joining me next Thursday for my third telephone townhall. 

To register, visit: https://t.co/ezUeQKPWZ3. https://t.co/b4DKDXAvCX

1491778495856496648.text:
I took to the House floor yesterday to call for an extension of the Child Tax Credit. 

I mentioned Shaneice, a mother of 3 from my district, who said the CTC helped her family make ends meet.

I want to start a thread of what the CTC meant to you ⬇️

1491531565838569477.text:
Today, the House passed the #GlobalRespectAct to deny visas to those who commit human rights abuses against LGBTQ people. 

Hate has no place in the United States.

1491468278316814336.text:
My district has one of the highest rates of childhood poverty in America.

The Child Tax Credit lifted children out of poverty, lowered hunger, and helped countless families make ends meet. 

Congress must extend it. https://t.co/gKo0sYvopQ

1491449324105920512.text:
Proud to support @RepAndyLevin's resolution recognizing Congressional workers' right to organize. 

#UnionStrong https://t.co/dxmYSWvujD

1491425947316555776.text:
In 1999, Stephanie Tubbs Jones became the first Black woman to represent Ohio in Congress. 

But she didn't just break barriers, she used her voice and her role to fight for justice and equality and to make Cleveland a better place for every person to live and raise a family. https://t.co/2k9Cphp2F4

1491425298331893760.text:
Mayor Carl Stokes and Congressman Louis Stokes rose from federally-funded housing to the heights of power.

As the first Black mayor of a major city and a founding member of @TheBlackCaucus, the Stokes brothers championed progress on civil rights and fought for the poor. https://t.co/xqGxIioAu5

1491424546871988227.text:
Decades later, in 1949, Jean Murrell Capers became the first Black woman elected to Cleveland City Council. 

Across her 10 years on Council and later service as municipal judge, Capers was a steadfast advocate for those who had long been left behind or forgotten in our city. https://t.co/3L1cXGgntW

1491423813560856582.text:
More than a century ago, Thomas Fleming became the first Black man to serve on Cleveland City Council. 

Councilman Fleming helped appoint Black workers to city jobs and secured passage of an ordinance preventing the Ku Klux Klan chapter from marching in Cleveland. https://t.co/h1GejgFi03

1491423801422512131.text:
Cleveland has a rich tradition of Black leaders who fought tirelessly for the people they represented.

My career in public service rests on their shoulders and their contributions. 

🧵

1491184942830997505.text:
The House just passed the largest reform of the @USPS in decades. 

Why is that so important? ⬇️
https://t.co/0MepYPSwrk

1491179864631943169.text:
The @USPS is critical to our country.

Yet decades of underinvestment and restrictions have led to reduced service and ongoing mail delays. 

I just voted for the Postal Service Reform Act to improve @USPS and ensure Americans receive their mail and deliveries on time.

1491123257084645376.text:
When oil companies say they are working towards the goals of the Paris Climate Agreement, they are not being straight with their investors, their shareholders, and the public. 

These misleading pledges worsen pollution and public health, especially in communities of color. https://t.co/1Zce4Sa6XP

1491100162302742529.text:
Shirley Chisholm shattered racial and gender barriers by becoming the first Black woman elected to Congress. 

Before me, it was her.

Before the record setting number of Black Women in Congress today, it was her. https://t.co/3gwGqCjbEo

1491057113275142148.text:
Public transit agencies in Northeast Ohio will soon get millions to replace outdated vehicles, build new garages and expand services.  

This is the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law in action. https://t.co/jnh2W62L8B

1491045658249543684.text: Make no mistake: the Biden agenda is creating jobs, rebuilding our infrastructure, and delivering results for  the people. https://t.co/R8NMs64TuC

1490685981636370437.text:
After the attack in Colleyville, Texas last month, I called for more funding for this critical program that ensures the safety and security of our synagogues and houses of worship. 

(2/2)
https://t.co/4u2IrnEJbJ

1490685980185137154.text:
Proud to join @RepColinAllred, @RepBethVanDuyne, 
@RepMondaire, and @RepTedLieu in urging @AppropsDems to increase funding for @fema's Nonprofit Security Grant Program.

(1/2)

https://t.co/pet1UQNzNi

1490680953945137159.text:
Outdated infrastructure in Northeast Ohio weakens our economy, threatens the safety of families, and impacts local businesses.

But thanks to the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, new projects will make our community a better place to live, work, and raise a family.

1489713417288044553.text:
I will always support workers and their right to organize, whether that's at the W. 6th Starbucks in Cleveland or in the halls of Congress.  

I am proud to support Congressional Staff in their efforts to unionize.  #UnionStrong

1489662804894396416.text:
On Rosa Parks Day, I am thinking of these words from the fearless civil rights icon: "You must never be fearful about what you are doing when it is right."

Her legacy of activism and bravery lives on in our struggle to build a more just America. https://t.co/fMiUoFFIbh

1489648678373576706.text:
467,000 jobs added in January. 

Like I was saying: https://t.co/qCGe0rC1NT

1489640419654881284.text:
Proud to cast my vote for the America COMPETES Act. 

This bill ensures technologies like semiconductors that will drive future growth are developed right here in America, while putting Ohioans to work in good-paying, domestic manufacturing jobs.

1489368627535036416.text:
The Port of Cleveland’s tonnage increased significantly in 2021, keeping goods moving across Northeast Ohio and beyond amid a year of supply chain challenges.

Thanks to the Infrastructure Law, new projects will help to increase capacity at our ports and make them more resilient.

1489295740706906115.text:
Last year was the greatest year of job creation in our history. 

And the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law means more jobs—good-paying, union jobs that can't be outsourced—in Ohio and across our nation.

1489266216443260938.text: Today, I'm participating in an @OversightDems roundtable to hear first-hand from victims of harassment and misconduct within @Commanders and examine how we can better protect ALL workers from harassment and discrimination. https://t.co/cj5GfutOGX

1489252305174028296.text:
Today marks 152 years since the 15th Amendment was ratified, granting African American men the right to vote.

It is a right that has been under attack ever since. 

Today, I remain committed to protecting every American’s access to the ballot box. #BHM

1488956639684268038.text:
I am proud to become the newest member to support Medicare for All.

Thank you, @RepJayapal! https://t.co/FhqzSF6ZEq

1488937333600788484.text:
In my first Congressional speech, I said I would fight for a day when no American goes hungry.

And I meant it.

That is why one of my very first bills was aimed at improving student access to school meals.

1488910317723832325.text:
Ohio has more lead pipes than all but one other state in the country. 

Thanks to the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, we will finally be able to ensure every person, in every zip code in our state, has access to safe drinking water.

1488889877848539140.text:
Let’s be clear: Israel is not an apartheid state.

Any mischaracterizations otherwise attempt to delegitimize Israel, a robust democracy, and will only serve to fuel rising antisemitism.

I will always advocate for a strong U.S.-Israel relationship founded on our shared values.

1488887412671631367.text:
Blessed to join my colleagues on the first day of #BlackHistoryMonth to celebrate the new Maya Angelou quarter!

"My mission in life is not merely to survive, but to thrive; and to do so with some passion, some compassion, some humor, and some style." 
— Maya Angelou https://t.co/48lqKyLkUT

1488636906216857604.text:
More than 50 percent of the roads in Cleveland and Akron have pavement in poor condition. 

The Infrastructure Law will help to repave roads, reduce commute times, and lower the amount of money drivers pay for car maintenance and repair.

1488606929068998671.text:
I was honored to join local leaders in Cleveland this weekend as @SherwinWilliams marked the start of construction of their new headquarters.

This project will not only build on the company's 155-year history in our city but also bring tremendous benefits to our communities. https://t.co/7P2oNB8lZP

1488585644276428807.text:
My office is in touch with @USPS to determine what is being done to resolve the ongoing mail delays affecting Northeast Ohio. 

In the meantime, if you need assistance with your mail, please reach out to our office at 216-522-4900.

1488563155731030017.text:
Happy Lunar New Year to all celebrating in #OH11 and around the world.  

May the #YearoftheTiger bring you courage, peace, and good health.

1488510471737167872.text:
During Black History Month, we remember that Black history is American history and honor the achievements and trailblazing contributions of African Americans. 

For me, this month is also a time to honor those who came before me and made my service in Congress possible. 

#BHM

1488270436530069508.text:
The first Social Security check was issued 82 years ago today.

This critical program supports more than 64 million Americans and keeps countless people out of poverty. 

I'm proud to support Social Security 2100, a bill to strengthen social security for generations to come.

1487096203758252038.text:
My thoughts are with all those injured in the bridge collapse in Pittsburgh today. 

This shows why the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law is so important. It makes the largest investment in generations to repair bridges, including the more than 1,000 in Ohio in poor condition.

1487063735793557506.text: @Ardhen26 I agree. And I am hopeful that the Law’s investment in our bus and rail systems, the largest in generations, will help to improve service and expand access to public transit.

1487062127487725570.text:
Did you drive or take public transportation to work this week?

Did you turn on your faucet to get a glass of water?

Did you open up your computer for school or work?

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will touch the lives of every American.

1486830024657354752.text:
STARTING SOON: At 6 PM ET, I will be hosting my second telephone townhall to discuss the historic Bipartisan Infrastructure Law.

Listen live by visiting https://t.co/ezUeQKPWZ3 or calling 833-946-1545. https://t.co/hS4NCnQkRa

1486825614686494720.text:
Today marks 2 years since Virginia became the 38th and final state needed to ratify the Equal Rights Amendment. 

I'm proud to support @RepSpeier & @RepMaloney's  new resolution recognizing ratification of the Equal Rights Amendment.

#ERANow

1486771687530147855.text:
Today is the day!

Join me tonight at 6 PM for my second Telephone Townhall on how the Infrastructure Law will benefit Northeast Ohio. 

Register at https://t.co/ezUeQKPWZ3. https://t.co/Ye5coKFXpj

1486766703656767495.text: Thank you, @POTUS, for upholding your commitment to nominating a Black woman to serve on the Supreme Court. https://t.co/PW24wjhRtj

1486708592891899908.text:
Today, on #HolocaustRemembranceDay, we remember the 6 million Jewish victims of the Holocaust and the countless lives that were changed forever by it.

With antisemitism on the rise, let us reaffirm that hatred, darkness and discrimination have no place here.

#NeverForget

1486436445149667333.text:
Around half of all Cleveland children live in poverty. 

The expanded Child Tax Credit helped thousands of families put food on the table, keep a roof over their heads, and pay their bills. That's why I won't stop pushing for an extension of this critical program.

1486410622564712451.text:
I am grateful for Justice Breyer's years of distinguished service on the Supreme Court. 

In light of his retirement, I fully support @POTUS’s commitment to nominating the first Black woman to the Supreme Court. 

It's time.

1486339961360199687.text:
Want to know how the new Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will impact you, your family and your community?

Join me for my second telephone townhall this Thursday at 6PM ET. 

Register today at https://t.co/ezUeQKPWZ3 https://t.co/wQsJVDYIRi

1486306054434660353.text:
Tax season is officially underway. 

If you received Child Tax Credit advance payments or stimulus payments in 2021, be on the lookout for filing info letters from the IRS. 

For more information ⬇️
https://t.co/itmaPl15Bl

1486144698028892168.text:
One year ago, President Biden signed an Executive Order that ensured thousands of transgender Americans could once again serve openly in the military. 

I thank @POTUS for his leadership, and I will always  advocate for policies that honor the dignity of transgender Americans.

1486072174951731200.text:
For decades, the Clean Air Act has helped improve the health of Americans, especially those living in minority and low income communities impacted most by air pollution.

I joined 190+ of my Democratic colleagues in urging #SCOTUS to protect every American's access to clean air. https://t.co/oJN8eYX5P3

1486020425310220290.text:
On this day 50 years ago, Shirley Chisholm became the first woman & African American to run for president—4 years after she became the first Black Congresswoman.

My career in public service rests on her contributions.

1485757692610236427.text:
The 2022 tax filing season starts today! 

Want to speed up the process? File electronically as early as possible and opt for direct deposit. 
 
Here’s more info on how to file ⤵️
https://t.co/WoyfeNBTp9

1485666082614562822.text:

1484881969242685440.text:
On the anniversary of the Roe decision, we cannot forget states across the country have passed laws threatening a woman's right to make her own personal health decisions.

It's time to codify the protections under Roe v. Wade.

It’s time to pass the Women's Health Protection Act.

1484552374920396805.text:
The Civil Rights Act was opposed by a Senate filibuster before it was signed into law in 1964.

The Voting Rights Act faced multiple obstacles before it was signed in 1965.

 This fight to protect the right to vote is far from over.

1484204230890213377.text:
I just voted for the EVEST Act to automatically enroll eligible veterans into VA healthcare services as they transition out of the military. 

This will ensure veterans have immediate access to the best physical and mental health care we can provide.

1484193723491790854.text:
The pandemic has worsened the hunger crisis in America, particularly among Black and Latino Families. 

During today's @HouseAgDems hearing, I asked @SecVilsack what @USDA is doing to address food waste, a root cause of hunger. https://t.co/jafF0odjGk

1484172094938173440.text:
One year ago, @POTUS & @VP took office.

More than 200m Americans are fully vaccinated.

A record 6.4m jobs were created.

Child poverty hit the lowest rate ever.

Largest Infrastructure Bill in generations signed into law.

That is what delivering for the people looks like.

1484123785246687232.text:
This is not the end of the road. Today is a new day.

I will not give up on our fight to protect the right to vote.

1484007974817386499.text:
I promise to keep fighting for voting rights. Why? Because it’s the right thing to do and because I know that a majority of Americans agree that we must protect the right to vote.

I refuse to lose my sense of hope—and I hope you won’t too.

1484007973974417408.text:
The last time the Voting Rights Act was renewed in 2006, every Senate Republican voted for it, including 16 senators still serving in Congress today. And a Republican President signed the bill into law.

Protecting the right to vote wasn’t partisan then—and it shouldn’t be now.

1484007972456087552.text:
I’m disappointed that the Senate didn’t reform the filibuster tonight to protect the right to vote.

Yet more than disappointed, I’m frustrated. Frustrated because Senate Republicans continue to stonewall every effort to pass the John Lewis Voting Rights Act.

🧵

1483850563070705667.text:
Here is how the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law is already delivering for Ohio:

$1.8 billion to repave roads and reduce commute times
$96.7 million to rebuild bridges
$71 million to replace lead pipes

It won't be long before shovels are in the ground and cranes are in the sky.

1483837164970467328.text:
In 2006, the Senate voted unanimously to renew the Voting Rights Act, and President Bush signed it into law. 

Protecting the right to vote wasn't political then—and it shouldn't be now.

Instead of literacy tests, we have strict ID requirements.

Instead of voter intimidation, we have long lines at the polls.

Instead of poll taxes, we have voter purges.

We must protect the right to vote

1483065126748102664.text:
This year, we must honor the life and legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. with not just words but action.

We cannot let this moment pass us by.

1482414742232879104.text: Happy Founder's Day to the inspiring women of Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Inc! Congratulations on 114 years of service.

Congress must extend it.

I’m listening—and I won’t stop fighting for both bills.

1479114710108676102.text:
Struck by these powerful words from President Biden: "I will stand in this breach. I will defend this nation. And I will allow no one to place a dagger at the throat of democracy."

I stand with you, Mr. President, in defense of our democracy. Nothing is more important.

1479076205777375236.text:
Today, as we honor the brave officers who defended the temple of our democracy and the members, staff, and all working in the Capitol that day, Congress must recommit to taking action to protect the right to vote and safeguard the integrity of our Republic.

3/

1479076204879790081.text:
Make no mistake: what occurred on January 6 was a direct assault on the Capitol and democracy itself. 

Yet the threat to our democracy continues. 

In 2021, 19 states passed 34 laws restricting access to the ballot box. 

2/

1479076203990507528.text:
Although I was not a Member of Congress when the violent attack on the Capitol took place on this day last year, I join my colleagues and all Americans in solemn observance of the anniversary of one of the darkest days in our history. 

1/

1478849297001201664.text:
The right to vote is an essential, democratic right. 

This isn't controversial, and it certainly shouldn't be partisan.

1475919979514146824.text:
Congress can walk and chew gum at the same time. 

It's nor either Voting Rights or Build Back Better. 

It's both/and.

CTC payments have kept more than 3 million children out of poverty.

We cannot let this critical program expire.

1473304086678323205.text:
I won’t stop fighting for the Build Back Better Act. 

From investing in childcare and college affordability to reducing the costs of health care and prescription drugs, the bill would cut costs for Ohio families and give them a long overdue shot at getting ahead.

1473003001908547592.text:
Thanks to the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, Ohio will get nearly $1.8 billion in funding in 2022 alone to fill potholes, rebuild roads, and create jobs across the state. 

This is just the beginning of the investments this bill will deliver to our region.

1471887372283482119.text:
Access to safe, reliable drinking water is a basic human right, not a privilege. 

Thanks to the leadership of @POTUS, Ohio will receive $242 million from the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law to upgrade water infrastructure and remove dangerous lead pipes across the state.

1471600814535983109.text:
Highway construction in the 1950s and ‘60s demolished homes and businesses and tore apart neighborhoods in Black communities nationwide.

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law includes long overdue funding to right this historical wrong and reconnect Black neighborhoods.

1471588653247959045.text:
To protect the right to vote

To safeguard our democracy

To honor those like John Lewis who faced down tear gas and billy clubs to secure this essential right

Congress must pass voting rights legislation.

1471206528355086336.text:
Make no mistake: climate change is an existential threat to our planet and humanity—and it will hit vulnerable communities first.

Inaction is not an option.

Together, the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law and the Build Back Better Act make historic investments in climate action.

1471158848023105537.text:

Lower hunger rates.

Millions of children lifted out of poverty. 

This is why the Senate must act⬇️ https://t.co/yMFoSAlqAj

Islamophobia is on the rise in America and across the world. 

We must make clear that hatred and bigotry have no place here.

1470948983656878082.text:

1470871164465684481.text:
African American history has been—and always will be—an inseparable part of the story of America.

1470463718928658441.text:
The last Biden Child Tax Credit payments will go out this week to 35 million families. The Build Back Better Act would keep these payments going beyond their Dec. 31 deadline. 

We cannot let children and families down.

1470409627963740169.text:
The Federal minimum wage has been stuck at $7.25 since 2009.

No one can cover their basic needs on $7.25/hour—and no one should ever have to try. 

That's why I cosponsored the Raise the Wage Act immediately after entering Congress.

1469437651367383057.text:
It's time to codify Roe v. Wade. 

It's time for the Senate to pass the Women’s Health Protection Act.

1468950160373919747.text:
Weekly jobless claims just hit a 52-year low.

Jobs Up. Wages Up. But our work doesn’t end there.

Together, the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law and Build Back Better Act will create 2 million good-paying jobs, allow more people to return to work, and bring down costs for families.

1468908470481174536.text: I’ll be joining @Morning_Joe today. Tune in at 7:30 a.m. to watch live! https://t.co/mVPZgzEtEj

1468699188829556740.text:
People have talked for years about delivering on infrastructure. 

Last month, we actually got it done.

I’m so glad I arrived in Congress just in time to help get this historic investment in roads, bridges, broadband, and drinking water across the finish line.

1468648885845467141.text:
@tify330 My colleague @RepBobbyRush has long fought for the Emmett Till Antilynching Act.

The bill is being marked up by the @HouseJudiciary Committee today 👇

1468602624136130565.text:
It’s 2021, yet lynching is still—STILL—not a federal hate crime. 

I strongly support the Emmett Till #Antilynching Act, because it would make lynching a federal hate crime and begin the process of closing a shameful chapter in our nation's history.

1468598710149996556.text:

I signed on to the Assault Weapons Ban just days after becoming a Member of Congress. 

Universal background checks, red flag laws, assault weapons ban—common sense gun safety measures cannot wait any longer.

1468341539877359622.text:

1468004182170996744.text:

It's also why I support the #CROWNAct, which puts an end to discrimination against black hair. https://t.co/IZcOlh1Yvu

1466839955016146957.text:
Let me get this right: force women to give birth, but ignore infant & maternal mortality.

Dictate a woman's health decisions, but it's not the government's job to ensure prenatal care, child care, preschool, or paid leave.

"Sanctity of Life," but block action on gun violence.

What is the best protection against COVID and the new Omicron variant? Get vaccinated—and get your booster now that everyone over 18 is eligible. 

I got mine this week—and so should you!

1466529273594867716.text: I want to set the record straight on the Build Back Better Act, because there are so many things in this bill to be excited about. https://t.co/zltf5B90Os

1466478781523283980.text: For more information on the bill, visit: https://t.co/mdYniYwiiG

1466478779983962120.text:
Classrooms across the country have grown overcrowded, even though we know smaller class sizes help our students succeed. 

Proud to join with @RepLucyMcBath & @SenJeffMerkley  to introduce the Smaller Class Sizes for Students and Educators Act to set every child up for success.

1466429150420426765.text:

1466183950552940544.text:

Today, on #RosaParksDay, we honor her bravery and remember how one person can effect change. https://t.co/1RFSVywrmn

1466164077764481028.text: Honored to preside over the House Floor for the first time as Speaker Pro Tempore! https://t.co/h9WtRz0xYv

1466126962938818570.text:
This #WorldAIDSDay, we remember those we have tragically lost to HIV/AIDS. 

We must continue to stand with survivors of HIV/AIDS, who are fighting stigma and discrimination, by recommitting to ending this devastating epidemic.

1466052489384534017.text:
Today, the Supreme Court will hear a case that could overturn Roe v. Wade.

Though I arrived in the House after it had passed the Women’s Health Protection Act, I strongly support this bill, which ensures reproductive health decisions are made between a woman and her doctor.

1465859642920161285.text:
I am honored that @SpeakerPelosi and my colleagues on the Steering Committee have nominated me to serve on @HouseAgDems & @OversightDems. 

These committees provide the perfect opportunity to advance accountability and justice and use my voice to fight for working families.

1465806133533282310.text:
Excited to be back in Washington. It’s going to be busy month, from getting the Build Back Better Act across the finish line to protecting our democracy. 

Time to roll up our sleeves and get to work.

1465715327195619328.text:
Ohio’s infrastructure scored a C- in 2021. That is simply unacceptable. 

The Bipartisan Infrastructure bill will bring billions to our state to repair crumbling roads and bridges, expand public transit, and update our airports and ports.

1465400080228311046.text:
The Build Back Better Act extends tax cuts for hardworking families and lowers their costs for education, child care, prescription drugs, health care, and housing.  

It's time to build an economy that works for all Americans, not just the wealthy few.

1465382763482255363.text:
The late Congressman John Lewis once said: "The right to vote is precious, almost sacred." 

I came to Congress to protect that essential American right.  I'll keep pushing for the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act—we cannot wait any longer.

1465031375514476553.text:
Sending warm wishes to all those in #OH11 and across the country celebrating Hanukkah. 

May the Festival of Lights brighten your hearts and homes. Chag Sameach! https://t.co/r2tj5QYWIT

1463855546260459524.text:
Wishing you and your family a safe and blessed Thanksgiving. 

I am always thankful for my family and friends, and I am especially grateful this year for the opportunity to serve the people of #OH11 in Congress. https://t.co/uaiAGayHd8

1463587748372258822.text:
Today’s verdict is a glimpse of what accountability in our justice system should look like. It is important that we remain vigilant to ensure the system works justly for all people in all cases. 

My prayers remain with Ahmaud Arbery’s family and loved ones.

1463532439456952323.text: From being sworn in and meeting with @POTUS to voting for the Bipartisan Infrastructure Bill and Build Back Better Act, I couldn't have scripted a better first couple of weeks in office. https://t.co/wdoI43UNg4

1463184171443146755.text:
These local veterans, who have already given so much to our country but are out delivering meals this holiday, embody the true spirit of Thanksgiving. 

May we all work to ensure no one is left behind, regardless of who they are or where they come from.
https://t.co/oauGO8mVQS

1463166066151071750.text:
America is one of the few countries worldwide without universal paid family and medical leave.  

The Build Back Better Act ends this national disgrace, ensuring no person has to choose between caring for themselves or their family and their paycheck.

1462870421213229059.text:
No person should have to choose between paying for prescription drugs or putting food on the table. 

That is why the Build Back Better Act allows Medicare to negotiate lower drug prices.

1462814794818408448.text:
Seven years ago today, 12-year-old Tamir Rice was killed by a police officer.

Tamir should be alive today, yet his family and our community still have not seen justice.

We need greater accountability in policing.  We need the Justice in Policing Act. https://t.co/9oKrrel5pu

1462156700379758600.text:
Happy Birthday, @POTUS! 

Thank you for your lifetime of service and continuing commitment to delivering results for the American people. I’m grateful for your leadership as we work to build this country back better.

1461726312670842883.text: Proud to join my colleagues in the @TheBlackCaucus who were instrumental in securing House passage of the bipartisan Infrastructure bill two weeks ago and the Build Back Better Act today. https://t.co/ezDmgciKQd

1461708324701970438.text:
This week, @POTUS signed the bipartisan infrastructure bill that invests in roads, bridges, public transit, and broadband.

The Build Back Better Act invests in people—families, seniors, children, students, and workers who have always been the backbone of our economy.

1461708323187826688.text:
The #BuildBackBetter Act:

Invests in childcare
Makes college more affordable
Lowers the costs of health care and prescription drugs
Builds more affordable housing

What’s more, it is fully paid for by making large corporations and wealthy Americans pay their fair share.

1461707382699008012.text:
I came to Congress to deliver results for hardworking families who have struggled to make ends meet for far too long, and that is exactly what the Build Back Better Act does. 

I'm proud to help pass this historic bill that gives all Americans a fair shot at getting ahead.

1461689709051224083.text:
It’s a new day, and I’m on my way back to the House floor to vote for the Build Back Better Act. 

Let’s get this done!

1461514310644125699.text:
Look who I bumped into in the halls of Congress between voting on bills this morning!

cc: @JoeNBC https://t.co/IYhqCyRQep

1461385713312837650.text:
I came to Congress to create good-paying jobs, address poverty, and put money back in the pockets of working families.  

The Bipartisan Infrastructure bill was step 1. 

Now it’s time for step 2: the Build Back Better Act. 

Let’s get this done!

1461098616718823437.text: My first two weeks in Congress have been a whirlwind, but my work here is just getting started. https://t.co/054SJysvZ4

1461087946086440963.text:
Threats of violence, especially from a sitting member of Congress, are unacceptable—full stop. 

Therefore, the House just voted to censure Rep. Paul Gosar for his indefensible and incendiary behavior.

1460693857851613185.text:
Slavery is America's original sin, resulting in generations of disparities that continue to impact our society today. 

I am proud to add my name in support of #HR40, @JacksonLeeTX18's bill to establish a commission to study and recommend reparation proposals. https://t.co/c0NJhe52fU

1460669215984304129.text:
The infrastructure bill signed into law yesterday by President Biden is a historic win for our country. 

But our work cannot end there. It's time to pass the Build Back Better Act to create jobs, reduce poverty, and put money back in the pockets of the American people.

1460422508738449414.text:
Proud to give my first @TheBlackCaucus Special Order Hour speech.

Together with the Infrastructure Bill, the #BuildBackBetter Act will create millions of good-paying jobs, reduce poverty, and rebuild the backbone of our country: the middle class.

https://t.co/oYTI5W3n8L

1460377996561461250.text: In addition to creating good-paying jobs, this bill will help to fill potholes, repair crumbling bridges, upgrade our public transportation systems, and expand access to high-speed internet. I am thrilled to bring home this historic win for our community.

1460370945651228675.text:
Proud to join my colleagues at the White House as @POTUS signed the largest infrastructure bill in generations into law!

I came to Congress to deliver results for the people, and that’s exactly what this bill does. https://t.co/S033DFhmoZ

1460343168117915664.text: Excited to be here at the White House as President Biden signs the bipartisan infrastructure bill into law! https://t.co/aILY29glNc

1460283330696515595.text: The historic infrastructure bill is not just about delivering billions to Ohio for roads, bridges, transit, and broadband—it will also bring countless good-paying jobs to communities across our state. https://t.co/JwE11blXHm

1459616635074097155.text: Tune in to MSNBC at 3:30p to watch my interview with @yasminv! https://t.co/jQObxjMmPm

1459249275926368261.text:
HBCUs expand access to education and unlock career opportunities for countless Black students each year, yet they have been underfunded for far too long. 

I'm proud to support the bipartisan IGNITE #HBCUExcellence Act to give these institutions the resources they deserve.

1459233207736537092.text:
I can't believe it's already been a week since I was sworn in and helped pass the largest infrastructure bill in generations. 

My work is just getting started. https://t.co/49rj7LB2GA

1458813282245038094.text:
Proud to support @RepNikema’s bill to rename Atlanta's main post office after John Lewis, who dedicated his life to confronting racism and injustice wherever he saw it.

Along with the John Lewis Voting Rights Act, this is one of the ways we continue to honor his life and legacy.

1458788497830072327.text:
Today we honor our veterans and their families, including the more than 700,000 veterans right here in Ohio.

But more than mere words, we must honor them with action. 

That’s why the Build Back Better Act includes $5 billion to help the VA system better serve our veterans. https://t.co/nGAA8R5bJG

1458180222377938945.text:
I believe that public service is always about putting the people first.

The bipartisan infrastructure bill is a win for the economy, a win for jobs and—that's right—a win for the American people.

1458147299071250435.text:
It was an honor to become the newest member of @TheBlackCaucus last week. 

Now, I'm ready to lock arms with my colleagues to deliver progress for Black Americans and the communities we serve. https://t.co/ppBWykdSMi

1457783059974004740.text:
What does the bipartisan infrastructure bill mean for Ohio?

➡️$9 billion to repair roads and bridges
➡️$1.2 billion for public transit 
➡️$100 million to expand broadband access
➡️$1.4 billion to ensure the safety of our drinking water
➡️ Countless jobs created across our state

1457448231168847879.text: Watch my full interview here: https://t.co/xrqimtiW7V

1457442718855086083.text:
Room: 10/10

Also 10/10?

Delivering historic investment in roads, bridges, broadband and safe drinking water on my first week in office. https://t.co/oW3nCyrYPZ

1456825861827596300.text: This bipartisan bill will help repair our crumbling roads and bridges, upgrade our public transit systems, and expand access to high-speed internet service, all while creating good-paying jobs in Northeast Ohio and across the country.

1456825860900655111.text: Proud to cast my vote in support of the largest infrastructure bill in decades on my second day as Congresswoman.

1456710884034850824.text:
I came to Congress to deliver results for the people. That means rebuilding our infrastructure, lowering health care costs, expanding access to childcare, making housing more affordable and giving working families a tax cut. 

I’m ready to vote yes on both bills, Mr. President. https://t.co/ghIcenjNFh

1456389610481889280.text:
Proud to be officially sworn in as Congresswoman!  

I'm honored and humbled to have the privilege of serving the people of #OH11 in the House of Representatives. 

Let's get to work. https://t.co/ZFItUDaqQE
